constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: AIRCZ Type:: Heathrow Planning Consultation Zone: All buildings, structures, erections and works exceeding 90 metres in height (295.3 feet)Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Heathrow Airport Limited, c/o Planning Services, First Point, Buckingham Gate, Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH6 0NT

AIRCZ Type:: Heathrow Planning Consultation Zone: All applications for developments likely to attract birds or connected with an aviation use.Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Heathrow Airport Limited, c/o Planning Services, First Point, Buckingham Gate, Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH6 0NT

description: Retention of single storey rear extension
decision_conditions: The applicant has demonstrated, on the  balance of probabilities, that the single storey rear extension was complete over 4 years ago and is therefore lawful under Section 171B(1) of the 1990 Town and Country Planning Act (as amended).

Your attention is drawn to the fact that planning permission does not override property rights, and that if your proposal involves construction on or near the site boundary then you should take appropriate steps to ensure that you havecorrectly identified the position of the boundary, that you do not build over it, and that any works which affect a neighbours property in any way have the benefit of the appropriate agreement from the landowner. Failure to undertakethe above steps may leave you liable to legal action by neighbouring landowners. If you require further information or advice, you should consult a solicitor.

Side Elevations Plans labels - there is confusion with the labelling of the Side Elevation plans, i.e. Existing Side Elevation 1 corresponds with Proposed Side Elevation 2, and vice versa. For the avoidance of doubt, please re-label the Side Elevation plans.
